TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CloudEvent extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a CloudEvent conforming to the 1.0 schema. This type has built-in serialization using System.Text.Json.

MemberSignature.Value: public CloudEvent (string source, string type, object? jsonSerializableData, Type? dataSerializationType = default);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string source, string type, object jsonSerializableData, class System.Type dataSerializationType) cil managed

new Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent : string * string * obj * Type -> Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent

Docs.param: Identifies the context in which an event happened. The combination of id and source must be unique for each distinct event.
Type of event related to the originating occurrence. For example, "Contoso.Items.ItemReceived".
Event data specific to the event type.
The type to use when serializing the data. If not specified, will be used on .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Usage: new Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent (source, type, data, dataContentType, dataFormat)

Docs.param: Identifies the context in which an event happened. The combination of id and source must be unique for each distinct event.
Type of event related to the originating occurrence. For example, "Contoso.Items.ItemReceived".
Binary event data specific to the event type.
Content type of the payload. A content type different from "application/json" should be specified if payload is not JSON.
The format that the data of a should be sent in when using the JSON envelope format.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using binary event data.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an identifier for the event. The combination of and must be unique for each distinct event. If not explicitly set, this will default to a .

MemberSignature.Value: public static Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent? Parse (BinaryData json, bool skipValidation = false);
.method public static hidebysig class Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent Parse(class System.BinaryData json, bool skipValidation) cil managed
Public Shared Function Parse (json As BinaryData, Optional skipValidation As Boolean = false) As CloudEvent
static member Parse : BinaryData * bool -> Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent

Docs.param: An instance of containing the JSON for the CloudEvent.

Set to to allow missing or invalid properties to still parse into a CloudEvent. In particular, by setting strict to , the source, id, specversion and type properties are no longer required to be present in the JSON. Additionally, the casing requirements of the extension attribute names are relaxed.
Docs.summary: Given a single JSON-encoded event, parses the event envelope and returns a . If the specified event is not valid JSON an exception is thrown. By default, if the event is missing required properties, an exception is thrown though this can be relaxed by setting the parameter.
Docs.exception: contained multiple events. should be used instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent[] ParseMany (BinaryData json, bool skipValidation = false);
.method public static hidebysig class Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent[] ParseMany(class System.BinaryData json, bool skipValidation) cil managed
Public Shared Function ParseMany (json As BinaryData, Optional skipValidation As Boolean = false) As CloudEvent()
static member ParseMany : BinaryData * bool -> Azure.Messaging.CloudEvent[]

Docs.param: An instance of containing the JSON for one or more CloudEvents.

Set to to allow missing or invalid properties to still parse into a CloudEvent. In particular, by setting strict to , the source, id, specversion and type properties are no longer required to be present in the JSON. Additionally, the casing requirements of the extension attribute names are relaxed.
Docs.summary: Given JSON-encoded events, parses the event envelope and returns an array of CloudEvents. If the specified event is not valid JSON an exception is thrown. By default, if the event is missing required properties, an exception is thrown though this can be relaxed by setting the parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time (in UTC) the event was generated, in RFC3339 format. If not explicitly set, this will default to the time that the event is constructed.
